answers.author: Susan Sherman
answers.text:
The City of Olathe, Kansas has combined Finance, Budget, Accounting, Purchasing, City Clerk and Human Resources into a Resource Management Department.  This was done several years ago to consolidate and save dollars.  I would be happy to send an organizational chart.   I think the positives are that the many of the central functions are located in one department and there is good internal communication between these divisions.  On the other side, HR is important function and sometimes needs direct access to the City Manager and we have made that work very well.  I would be happy to discuss further if you are interested.

author: Emily Lucas
text: I am looking for examples of local governments (preferably cities) where the Finance Department and the HR Department are combined into one department.  I would like to see what your organizational chart looks like and the pros and cons of a combination department.  Thank you.
title: Combined HR/Finance Department
